result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bruce Alan Blaser in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Bruce Alan Blaser. Attorney Sarbacker requested a preliminary hearing. Notice given by JA. 9:13 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:49 PM Defendant Bruce Alan Blaser in court. Court found the defendant indigent, appointed attorney Steve Sarbacker . Defendant is to pay $50.00 per month starting 7-15-22 and every month after.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Return date scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Indigency hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:50 pm. Return date scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bruce Alan Blaser appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail with Attorney Peter Middleton. Waived reading. Right to atty. $500.00 signature bond. Standard felony conditions. Waived time limits. Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:50 pm. Return date scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am. 1:22 PM
